page.title: 07Farming in the Mellor Area
page.content:
The average farmer owns or tennants 100 acres. The farmers have between 75 and 248 cows, mainly Fresian. the largest farm milk delivery is 1,040 pints per day. All the farmers milk their cows at 6.00a.m. and 4.30p.m. daily but earlier in the winter time. The largest flock of sheep is 250, mostly masham and mules. These produced 150 lambs in March 1985.
Farmers in {Mellor} grow grass only for hay, silage and pasture. Items of machinery are the tractor, a manure spreader, a slurry tanker, a bale elevator, a mower, a rake and various trailers.
